name: Beetl
body:
# BEETL: Burrows-Wheeler Extended Tool Library

BEETL is a suite of applications for building and manipulating the 
Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) of collections of DNA sequences. 
The algorithms employed in BEETL are intended to scale to collections of 
sequences containing one billion entries or more.

The initial release implements two flavours of an algorithm for
building the BWT of a sequence collection - BCR and BCRext.

Subsequent releases will add functionality for efficient inversion and
querying of BWTs.

Questions and queries can be sent to the BEETL [mailing list] (http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/BEETL/)

## Contributors

* Markus J. Bauer, Illumina UK (now at Boehringer Ingelheim)
* Anthony J. Cox, Illumina UK (project lead)
* Tobias Jakobi, University of Bielefeld
* Giovanna Rosone, University of Palermo
* Ole Schulz-Trieglaff, Illumina UK

## Papers about BEETL

* Markus J. Bauer, Anthony J. Cox and Giovanna Rosone
_Lightweight BWT Construction for Very Large String Collections._ 
Proc. CPM 2011, doi: 10.1007/978-3-642-21458-5_20

* Markus J. Bauer, Anthony J. Cox and Giovanna Rosone
_Lightweight algorithms for constructing and inverting the BWT of string collections._
Theoretical Computer Science, doi: 10.1016/j.tcs.2012.02.002

* Anthony J. Cox, Markus J. Bauer, Tobias Jakobi and Giovanna Rosone
_Large-scale compression of genomic sequence databases with the Burrows-Wheeler transform._
Bioinformatics, doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/bts173
